characters: AT THE BACK OF THE AUDITORIUM
THE OPEN TRUNK OF THE CAR
THE OLD TIMERS WITH FOLEY WATCHING THEM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley comes out, he calmly walks to a Honda Civic and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley tries to start the car.  No go.  He tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... But the car won't start.  Foley bangs on the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Foley then stiffens as a cop sticks his gun through the o window into Foley's ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you flooded it. Foley looks to the passenger window, where ANOTER COP, sm now has his gun pointing at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out've the car, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna hear a funny story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and get out've the car. And as Foley obliges, we then... FADE TO WHITE. We hear a MAN GRUNT.  Then see Foley in SLOW MOTION as he through frame, now we see a basketball come up in his han we realize he's on his way to the rim when... ...ANOTHER GUY rams into him in mid-air, knocks him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BASKETBALL GAME in progress.  All of the men, Foley inc are dressed in blue coveralls and white T-shirts.  The ga rough.  Hair is pulled.  Eyes are poked.  Faces punched. A title reads: "GLADES CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION.  BELLE G

dialogues.speaker: FLORIDA."
dialogues.text: Foley is the oldest player here.  He's getting tired, sta lose his breath.  He finally walks off the court, breathi hard he can't even talk.  He simply motions to SOME YOUNG to come in and take his place. Foley sits down on a bench, tries to catch his breath.  H across the yard to where...

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF ELDERLY INMATES
dialogues.text: sitting around a wooden picnic table are playing cards. them are over sixty.  One of them, a one-legged guy on cr hops away from the table, spits out some tobacco as we...

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD TIMERS WITH FOLEY WATCHING THEM
dialogues.text: As we see one old guy is making a picture frame out of ol Mal and Lucky Strike packs.  Another tends to a tomato bu a tiny patch of garden near the wall.  Another one sits n painting a picture of a man and a boy fishing from a rowb Foley is about to get up off the bench when something cat his eye.  He watches as...

dialogues.speaker: TWO LATINO MEN
dialogues.text: both little guys, jog past the game, slow to a walk, then and begin stretching out.  One of them nods to Foley.  Fo nods back, waits for the Latin guys to walk off, then wal over to a guard, PUPKO ("PUP"), heavy-set, dumb as dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something, Foley? Foley keeps his eyes fixed on the basketball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people are going out of here. What if I told you where and when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect you to look out for me, Pup, let me run off work details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  How many going out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but I won't tell you just yet. Meet me in the chapel at eight-thirty, right before lock-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley takes his tray up the centre aisle, he scans the of white T-shirts until he sees the two little Latins sit at a table full of other little Latins.  CHINO -- fifties shape -- shovels macaroni in his mouth. Chino's "wife", LULU, nineteen, looks up from his own nea of macaroni and jello and watches Foley walk past and sit with a bunch of bikers. Foley watches as the guy across from Chino scrapes some m off his plate and on to Chino's and Chino wolfs that down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chino steps outside and lights a cigarette.  He puts an a around Lulu, starts to walk off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's the day, huh? Chino looks over, watches Foley approach, lets his arm sl down so he can hook his thumb into Lulu's belt... the nex thing to having him on a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You excited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, man, Super Bowl Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I see you moved it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you think is today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were out running this morning, sticking to your routine, anybody happened to notice.  But you only did a couple of miles instead of your usual five.  Saving yourself for the main event.  Then I see you inside eating ten pounds of macaroni. Carbohydrates for endurance. Chino and Lulu exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want, I tole you you can come. You all right, Foley.  I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me I can come 'cause I caught you digging the fuckin' tunnel, saw you and Lulu coming out of the bushes, thought maybe you two were making out. Foley smiles at Lulu, who glares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, you finish ahead of schedule? Chino looks towards the fence along the front of the yard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what they doing, those posts out there?  Putting up another fence, five metres on the other side of the one that's there.  We wait until Super Bowl Sunday, they could have the second fence built and we have to dig another nine, ten days.  So we going soon as it's dark.  You want -- I mean it -- you can still come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate the offer.  And it's tempting. Foley looks off towards the visitors' parking area, the f not twenty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, man, it's a long run to civilization.  A hundred miles to Miami? I'm too old to start acting crazy, try a stunt like that.  You make it out, send me a postcard.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: where we see someone has written "IT'S MAGIC!" then cross the "IT'S" and replaced it with the word "LIKE".  We hear PHONE RING AND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami Beach Moderne.  ADELE -- mid-thirties, pretty, Fole sits at her kitchen table writing on a pad.  She grabs th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (then, sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Adele, how you doing? INTERCUTTING FOLEY & ADELE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bank Robber, want some advice? Next time, leave the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, Adele.  How many more times you gonna gimme that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till it's not funny any more.  What do you want, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that Super Bowl party?  They changed the date.  It's on tonight, eight-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you tell me one-time calls aren't monitored?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said not as a rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you come right out and tell me what you're talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to Miss Smarty Mouth.  Out there in the free world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's free about it?  I'm looking for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Mandrake the Magician?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emil the Amazing.  The bastard fired me and hired another girl, a redhead. I'm working on a new business card, pass out to the cafes.  How's this sound--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Adele, the reason I called, that party is today instead of Sunday. About eight-thirty, like only a few hours from now.  So you'll have to get hold of Buddy, whatever he might be doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the one driving the other car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, seeing as you have so much luck with cars, Buddy thought it might be better to bring two.  He got this guy he says you know from Lompoc, Glenn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn Michaels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's him.  Buddy says Glenn thinks you guys are real cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did, huh.  Well, tell Buddy I see Glenn wearing his sunglasses I'll step on 'em.  I might not even take 'em off first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MARSHALL SISCO -- fifty -- slides a small wrapped box a table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday. ...to where KAREN SISCO -- twenty-eight, black suit, long a knockout -- sits.  She picks up the box and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fit another Chanel suit in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something better.  Open it. Karen starts to carefully unwrap the present.  Marshall w takes a sip of his drink, looks around the bar, sees how everyone's looking at the two of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens the box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... She pulls a gleaming automatic pistol from the box...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Sig-Sauer .38.  I love it. She leans across the table and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, kid. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.  I gotta drive out to Glades, then I'm meeting Ray Nicolet at ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is that?  The ATF guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was.  Ray's with the F.B.I. now, he switched over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still married though, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically.  They're separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's moved out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they're not separated, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we change the subject?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing at Glades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serving process, a Summons and Complaint.  Some con doing mandatory life doesn't like macaroni and cheese. He files suit, says he has no choice in what they serve and it violates his civil rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can always step in, work with me full-time as one of my investigators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd meet doctors, lawyers -- nothing wrong with them necessarily if they're divorced.  Why settle for some cowboy cop who drinks too much and cheats on his wife?  That's the way those hotshots are, all of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't get to talk much any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout I come next Sunday and watch the Super Bowl with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that. She gets up, kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the gun, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley comes in, lies down on the bunk.  He looks about th cell.  All he's got to show for himself.  It's now quiet the cellblock.  Foley closes his eyes and we...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A few hundred cons scream encouragement/insults as MAURIC "SNOOPY" MILLER, a lanky, scary, mean-looking black man i trunks, hits a white guy with a ferocious hook. Title reads: LOMPOC FEDERAL PENITENTIARY.  LOMPOC, CALIFO And then... TWO YEARS AGO.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK OF THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Foley leans in a doorway watching with BUDDY BRAGG -- bla Foley's age, shaved head. The BELL SOUNDS and the white guy staggers to his corner, does Maurice.  GLENN MICHAELS -- surfer look, dark shades counts cash in Maurice's corner, whispers something into fighter's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ref don't call it pretty soon, Snoopy's gonna send this guy out in a body bag. Foley watches a MAN -- fifties, out of place, not as hard as those around him.  The guy looks nervous, can feel the cons' eyes on him as he tries to find a seat. The BELL SOUNDS and the white boxer staggers to his feet. Maurice steps in and resumes the bloody pummelling.  Fole and watches the fight now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone ever tell you why they call him Snoopy? Buddy shakes his head.  Maurice dances around the other g now.  Teases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was Maurice "Mad Dog" Miller back when he was pro.  Now you pet him, he goes down. The white guy throws a tired, loping roundhouse that bare glances off Maurice's jaw.  Sure enough, Maurice makes a show out of snapping his head back, staggering, before he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Foley watches the new inmate as fights erupt all around h and, anxious now, he tries to get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley and Buddy sit atop a cement picnic table watching a nearby, the "winning" BOXER -- still wearing last night's pummelling on his face -- gloats to a group of cons.  He a fake punch at one of them as he demonstrates his winnin technique...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy's braggin' he won a thrown fight. Fuckin' pathetic. Foley looks at the other side of the yard where Maurice n stands at the far side of the yard coldly watching the gu hand thrust into his pocket.  Foley watches as Maurice st the NEW INMATE -- the older guy who looked out of place a fights -- as he comes out into the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Richard Ripley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wall Street guy?  Oh, yeah.  I didn't recognize him without his rug. Foley watches as Maurice talks to the new inmate, the guy nodding, acquiescent, respectful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick the Ripper they called him, on account of all the people he ripped off. Foley watches as Ripley now makes a note in a BLACK BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years. They look to where Glenn Michaels, the blond guy in dark we saw in Maurice's corner, works out on the bench press feet away.  He's shirtless, tan, in shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got three years and fined fifty million dollars and wrote 'em a fucking check.  Like that, fifty mil, signed his name. (struggles with the bar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa-- little help here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you talkin' to, Studs?  Me, or Buddy.  I can't tell, you got those shades on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys-- come on-- this is too heavy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the bright glare out here made it hard to see the numbers on the weights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the shades off.  Just get this fuckin' thing off me. Foley helps him get the bar up.  Glenn sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know he wrote a check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me.  He works the laundry with me.  The guy loves to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, to the U.S. Attorney.  I hear he rolled over on all the snitches he was doing business with and got 'em all brought up. He watches Snoopy talking to Ripley, one eye always on th swaggering boxer across the yard, one hand in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, anybody that can write a check for fifty mil, he says anything I'm all fucking ears. Like the other day, he tells me how he's got all this money in foreign banks, plus around five mil in uncut diamonds at his house. He said, quote, "Where I can put my hands on it anytime."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.  Where's the guy live? Foley watches a few more of Maurice's friends surround Ri Again, Ripley takes out his black book, starts nodding, m notations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detroit.  Snoopy Miller told me uncut diamonds are as easy to move as cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever seen an uncut diamond, Studs? They look like plain old rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point is, that's probably what you're gonna end up with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's lying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your head.  The guys got five million lying around his house, you really think he's gonna tell some motormouth he just met in prison about it? A BELL SOUNDS.  Everyone starts walking for the gate. Foley watches as the Boxer and his crew head for the gate Maurice still standing there with his hand in his pocket. SLOW MOTION AS the boxer gets to the gate, sees Maurice w moves to him now, smiling like he's so glad to see him... left hand clapping the guy on the back, saying something congratulations as now his right hand comes out of his po and we see the long metal shiv--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Snoopy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes. Maurice wraps his left arm around the boxer's shoulder an him tight for a moment, then quickly moves away.  The Box stands there like a statue, doesn't move until he's at la jostled from behind and his legs fold and he drops to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the Snoop doesn't like to lose, even if it's on purpose. We hear a WHISTLE BLOW as a GUARD spots the body.  And no everyone moves like hell for the gate... except for... Richard Ripley who stands there frozen, staring down at t body. Foley glances back at the approaching guards, casually ta Ripley by the arm as he passes, leads him away from there to him as they walk into the block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wanna be standing there, the hacks start asking questions you don't wanna answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, right, thanks... Foley then moves away.  He sees Maurice looking back at h giving him a hard stare just before he melts into the cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies there another moment when... A PAIROF LEGS swings down over the side from the top bunk Foley's CELLMATE jumps down, walks the three feet or so t toilet, casually pulls down his pants and starts to go to bathroom.  Foley shakes his head and turns away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy walks up to a Cadillac Sedan DeVille Concours pu a slim-jim from the back of his pants, about to jimmy the when he sees... A WOMAN -- middle-aged, wearing pearls and high heels -- out of the Winn Dixie pushing a grocery cart full of groc Buddy sticks the jimmy back in his pants, waits until the is opening her trunk before coming forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, lemme help you with those, ma'am. She doesn't seem too sure about it, but lets him load the groceries in the trunk and take the key out of the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for your help, so don't expect a tip. Buddy smiles, waves her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, ma'am.  I'll just take your car. She stands there stupidly as he gets in and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of a remodel.  As door opens and Pup comes i Foley puts a finger to his lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right underneath you, Pup. They dug a tunnel. Foley watches Pup creep up the aisle towards the front of chapel, eyes on the floor, listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear 'em.  Where's the tunnel come out? Pup turns his back, walks up the aisle and across the fro the pews to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second fence post from the tower out there.  Go on, take a look. As Pup stares out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see nothing there. Foley reaches down into a pew where's stashed a FOUR-FOOT CRUCIFIX.  He picks it up, starts up the aisle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will directly.  Keep watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the high beams from her car show the prison parking ar then the fence strung with razor wire.  Karen parks near fence, lights a cigarette and dials her car phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Karen Sisco again for Ray Nicolet. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not?  Could you tell him that... never mind.  I'll call back. Headlights hit Karen's rear-view mirror, a car pulling in her.  The lights go off, then come on again.  She adjusts mirror to deflect the glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy sits watching the cons come in from the athletic He sees the mirror flash in the car in front of him as Ka checks her face out in the rear-view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley moves up behind Pup, he lets his jacket fall to holds the crucifix down against his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There some car headlights out there... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... Now he pulls his radio from his belt, says into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man outside the fence!  By tower six! (responds to radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Officer Pupko... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at him, for Christ's sake! Okay-- now Foley raises the metal cross, steps in and lay smack against the side of Pup's head.  Drops him clean wi swing, bouncing him off the window frame and down without sound coming from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen grabs the court papers off the seat, opens her c door, glances at the fence and pauses as she sees A FIGUR crouching down. Karen turns on her headlights. No, not crouched. The gu coming out of the ground. On this side of Head and shoulders appear and another guy comes out of th ground. Right in front of her. Karen leans on the horn, holds it down and sees the two g the fence -- Chino and Lulu -- look into her headlights, there for a moment before taking off into the dark. Kare out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy watches a spotlight from the tower come on and f the two cons as we then hear the sound of RIFLE REPORTS b the men disappear into the dark. Then Buddy sees Karen in his headlights, whistles softly gets a good look at her long legs as she raises the lid t trunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing? He watches her duck her head in the trunk and come out wi holstered pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. But then she throws the pistol in the trunk, ducks in the again and comes out this time racking a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. And now Buddy watches her hurry to the front of her car a raise the shotgun as we hear A WHISTLE BLOW IN THE COMPOU Buddy gets out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen puts the shotgun on two more cons, both filthy d standing by the hole they just crawled out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands in the air! Buddy watches the two cons, both Latins, make up their mi start edging away -- shit, they've come this far. They look out at the spotlight sweeping around in the dar then look the other way, along the fence towards the main to see armed hacks coming out on the run, and that decide for the cons.  They take off running... Now Buddy watches as Karen puts her pump gun on them, but fire... The hacks running from the gate with rifles beat her to i open up all at once and keep firing until the two convict cut down as they run. The hacks glance at Karen, but don't bother with her, mor interested in the hole the convicts had come out of.  Now standing by it peering in, edging closer with their weapo ready, then they all step back at once, bump into each ot as... A head appears wearing a guard's baseball cap, the guy no something to the guards, his face smeared with muck, exci pointing towards the orange grove. They run off, pausing briefly to kick the convicts they s see if they're alive, then keep going. The man in the hole, Foley, climbs out.  He takes his tim puts on a show, standing with his hands on his hips like honest-to-God hack, that serious cap down on his eyes. Buddy waves to Foley to come on and Karen turns and puts shotgun on Buddy.  Buddy raises the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey, we're good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here? Not so much asking, but putting it to him the way cops do they're already pretty sure what you're doing.  She glanc around to include Foley, now coming at her like some crea out of the swamp, giving Buddy time to take her around th She fights him, jabs him in the gut with the butt end of shotgun before Foley wrenches it from her grip. They drag her to the rear end of her car, the trunk lid s up, and crouch there as some hacks come running along the past the dark gun tower and cross the road towards the or grove.  A moment later, they hear bursts of gunfire, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet that's all the hacks they send out.  Otherwise nobody's left to mind the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we talk about it later? He turns to see Foley and Karen staring at each other in headlights from Buddy's car; Karen not at all afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you're just a girl.  What do you do for a living you pack a shotgun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a federal marshal and you're under arrest, both of you guys. Foley keeps staring at her like he's giving the situation thought, but what he says is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet I smell, don't I? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you hop in the trunk and we'll get out of here. Karen looks at him, then gets up, climbs into the trunk. reaching around, trying to find her pistol, when... Foley gives her a shove and gets in with her, wedging her the wall of the trunk, pressing against her back like the cuddled up in bed. He holds her to him, giving her no room to turn and stick gun in his face.  Buddy reaches for the trunk lid and the everything goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two outta what, twenty? Himey bulldozes forward, pulling his massive fist back to Foley in the head when... ...in one swift motion Foley brings his book up in one ha like he's throwing a pie, and drives the hefty repair man into Himey's face, snapping the big guy's head back, send his feet flying out from under him so that he hits the fl back-first with a loud thud. Maurice goes for Foley who picks up the chair just as we WHISTLE.  They all freeze, look to...

dialogues.speaker: A PRISONER AT ANOTHER TABLE
dialogues.text: Who nods towards the door.  We PAN OVER just as A GUARD A takes in the scene as a dazed Himey slowly pulls himself covers his now bleeding nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, reading's funnamental an' shit, we just excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear outta here. The guard exits.  Maurice and Foley are still staring at other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Snoopy?  Did we settle the fish thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Foley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure.  It's all settled. He pours the water out of the bag and drops the fish into Ripley's open hand.  Maurice then squeezes Ripley's hand fist, crushing the fish.  He taps his fist to Ripley's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you do it. Maurice gives Foley a last look, starts out of the room w Himey.  Ripley looks at the crushed fish in his hand, the Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time. We hear a PHONE RING and then...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: As Maurice lies in bed watching a boxing match on televis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick and jab, fool.  Stick and jab. A frisbee whizzes past the television.  We hear A DOG YEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Watch that shit! Maurice's girlfriend MOSELLE - about thirty, sleepy-eyed, green bathrobe - picks the frisbee up off the floor as TH RINGS AWAY on the bedside table right next to Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuffy.  C'mere, boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna answer the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?  It's not for me. Maurice watches as Moselle now tries to throw the frisbee little wire-haired terrier, but it just bounces off the d head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoops up the dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moselle, the fuck are you doing to my little Tuffy? He lovingly nuzzles the dog like it's his child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trainin' Tuffy, so he can be on a Kal Kan commercial, make us some extra money. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the dumbest thing I heard in my life.  Everybody knows Kal Kan doesn't pay for shit.  You gonna get a gig, it's gotta be for one of the big three: Science Diet, Iams or that Cycle shit for the fat dogs.  Now answer the fuckin phone. She comes over, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (hands it to Maurice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An antsy Glenn with his shades on talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoopy.  Glenn Michaels. INTERCUTTING GLENN & MAURICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Studs.  Hey, son, you must be one a them psychic friends.  I was just thinkin' about you. Glenn watches as some guy in a suit gets out of a black L Town Car and jogs to the john.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Snoopy, I'm on my way up to Detroit and need a place to crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy, come up here?  It's fuckin one degree outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk to you about a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really go into it right now. I'll just tell you it's someone big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone?  Gimme a hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a guy you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme another hint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Richard Ripley. Maurice doesn't say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm here, all right.  I'm very here. Question is, why aren't you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley and Buddy hurry up the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying she wasn't scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause she had her hand on her gun the whole time, waiting to make her move. Buddy opens the door, looks at Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just jealous it was me in the trunk with her and not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "hideout."  Not much in the way of furnishings.  Foley Buddy inside, watches as he bolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing I'm gonna do is get all this mud off me. Foley starts for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been dreaming about a hot bath for the last six months.  Soak the prison off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some lilac oil, you want some, a vanilla candle under the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something about a nice hot bath, transforms a person.  It's not just about opening up your pores, know what I mean?  There's just something about the heat and the wet that's calming you know?  Settles me in a way that I really can't articulate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you mean.  It's just a feeling. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I could go for some wine tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a store around the corner, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds great. Foley goes into the bathroom.  A moment later WE HEAR THE RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy leaves the apartment, starts down the hall, KARE INTO FRAME, watches as he disappears down the stairs.  Gu she then moves towards the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley undresses, picks up a candle off the sink and sm it.  He notices his nude image in the mirror and checks h out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen slips the door.  She looks around, HEARS THE WAT RUNNING. She racks the slide on her gun, snicks off the safety and for the bathroom.  Suddenly, the water is turned off.  Sh where she is.  She then moves a careful step at a time to the open doorway. Gradually the tub comes into view, beginning with Foley's resting crossed on the other end, then the middle of the then she's in the doorway, looking down at... Foley, lying there in the tub, his eyes closed.  Karen cu eyes down the length of him, taking a moment here to chec out, long enough for Foley to open his eyes and grab her the one holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. They look at each other a moment.  He then pulls her down him and kisses her.  She kisses him back.  He then pulls into the tub with him as we now hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen...?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: As she opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Flowers everywhere.  Karen -- bruises on her face -- lies bed.  Her father, Marshall, sits on the chair beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking in your sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hey, yourself."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. We hear A KNOCK at the door.  They look to where Special DANIEL BURDON -- black, forties, expensive suit -- stands the doorway, file in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marshall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Burdon, FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall Sisco.  Karen's dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind please waiting outside.  We have some business to do here. Marshall looks at him a moment.  Then, to Karen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go to the john anyway. Burdon waits for Marshall to walk out, then sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be on the task force, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice of you to offer, Karen, but I got all the help I can use right now.  Instead, let's talk about how you got the bump on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that my report you're holding onto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I want to hear you tell it. Starting with when you tried to grab the wheel -- where was this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming to the Okeechobee exit... And now we see it...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Going over a hundred miles per hour, blowing past cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the next exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenn, take the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way, man, no fuckin' way am I gonna turn myself in. She reaches over and grabs the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing?! He hits the brakes.  The car goes off the road, down the the abutment coming right at us as we go back to...

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSPITAL ROOM
dialogues.text: As Burdon sets the file down, sits back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next thing I knew, the paramedics were taking me out the car. Burdon looks at Karen a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a couple of points I keep wondering about have to do with the two guys that grabbed you.  Buddy is it?  And this fella Jack Foley.  I swear the man must've robbed two hundred banks in his time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Huh.  He told me he didn't remember how many he robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the trunk, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... different things, prison, movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fella holds you hostage, you talk about movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an unusual experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley made me think of that fella Carl Tillman, the one you were seeing, it turns out the same time he was doing banks.  You recall that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was seeing Carl Tillman, I didn't know he robbed banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I had enough reason to believe he did, and I told you.  So you had to at least suspect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened to Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time came, you shot him.  But you didn't shoot Foley or the guy with him.  They're unarmed, you had a shotgun and you let them throw you in the trunk. Okay, now you got your Sig in your hand.  You say in the report you couldn't turn around, he had you pinned down.  But when the trunk opened, how come you didn't cap the two guys then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you would've done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say in the report Glenn didn't have a gun, but you let him get away, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, what do you work on most of the time, fraud?  Go after crooked bookkeepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, I've been with the Bureau fifteen years, on all kinds of investigations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever shot a man?  How many times have you been primary through the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to qualify, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to know what you're talking about. We hear CHUCKLING OS.  Burdon glances at the doorway wher see Marshall now standing, enjoying this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk another time, Karen.  All right?  I'd like to know why Foley put you in that second car when he didn't need you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds to me like he liked having you around.  I'll see you, Karen.  Mr. Sisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Burdon. Marshall waits for him to walk out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white man's Burdon.  That's what everybody calls him in Miami.  The Metro-Dade guys.  He's got a knack for pissing people off. She's not listening.  He sits down, takes her hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sig Sauer you got me for my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, you're a good girl, you might get another one for Christmas. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it back when I get Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen GERIATRIC RESIDENTS sit on chairs out front as Bu climbs the steps carrying a bag of groceries under one ar newspaper under the other.  An old woman comes out the do Buddy opens it and squints at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--  Are you delivering the oxygen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, ma'am.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's REAL apartment, not the one Karen pictured in her This one's nicer, with a view of the beach.  Jack stands balcony going through KAREN'S PURSE. He pulls out her wallet, checks out her driver's licence He does the same with her gym I.D. card.  He finds her ad book and opens it up.  A photo of her father slips out. examines it a moment, then flips through the book. He stares at something in her bag a moment, then reaches and comes up with her us Marshal I.D.  He slips it open a studies the badge and the picture opposite. He holds on to it, looks out at the ocean, but really see

dialogues.speaker: THE OPEN TRUNK OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: As Karen gets out, saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Foley turns away from the view as Buddy walks in, sets th grocery bag down on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made the front page. He holds up the newspaper so that Foley can see his pictu the front page: an unflattering mug shot that doesn't loo that much like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass this picture around you can go anywhere you want, nobody'll know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't feeling my best that day. I'd just drawn thirty to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this'll make you feel better. Buddy reaches into the bag, tosses Foley a NEW ZIPPO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Foley catches the lighter, immediately begins playing wit He looks at the paper on the coffee table as Buddy sits d pulls some groceries and a sixpack from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paper says there's ten grand each on you, Chino and Lulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say anything in there about Karen Sisco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that she got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what happened after she drove off with Glenn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to ask Glenn.  And most likely, he's on his way to Detroit, where we should be. Foley walks back out on to the balcony, looks at the cont Karen's bag spread out on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize what you're doing?  Worrying about a person that works in law enforcement.  You want to sit down and have cocktails with a girl that tried to shoot you.  You hear what I'm saying? Foley holds up the picture of Marshall Sisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think this old guy is her boyfriend? It's the only picture she carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I going to Detroit by myself? Foley picks up her drivers licence photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer we hang around down here, Jack, better chance there is either Glenn's gonna fuck up the whole score, or we gonna get busted, or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll leave first thing in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on a marina.  Boats bobbing on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Foley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall sits in his chair holding up a newspaper as Kare him a drink.  She stares at the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even look like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he looks a lot... She realizes Marshall's watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different. The doorbell RINGS.  She ignores his look, gets up.  Walk the door and opens it to reveal RAY NICOLET, boots, leath jacket, etc.  Cowboy Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great.  Your dad taking good care of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took the week off so we'd have time together.  So far he's worked on his boat every day.  Dad?  Ray Nicolet. Marshall gets up, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard a lot about you, Mr. Sisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray's with the F.B.I. Task Force, working on the prison break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing his T-shirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that. Ray turns to Karen, holding his jacket open to show the t force inscription on his T-shirt in red, the guy's .357 t into his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case no one knows what he does. Tell me, Ray, you ever wear one says, "Undercover"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  We got one of 'em. Karen looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it Foley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before he can answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a tip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, someone spotted two of 'em in this hobo camp out by the airport, called the number--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it, soon as I saw they were offering a reward. She grabs Nicolet by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it Foley? Marshall looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley?  Oh.  No, it was one of the Cubans.  Linares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went out there, full SWAT, two choppers, the whole bit, but Linares started shooting anyway.  We put him down, but somehow Chirino got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pay the guy the reward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, as soon as we got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley hadn't been there? Her father gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place was strictly Cuban.  If Foley had a ride he must have his own agenda. He seems to be the only one knows what he's doing. THE PHONE RINGS.  Marshall moves to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she is.  Just a minute. (hands her the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: On the balcony. Flipping through a copy of Vogue watches television inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. INTERCUTTING KAREN & FOLEY - DAY Karen just stands there, sees her father looking at her a drones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She walks out to her father's balcony now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see if you're okay, make sure Glenn didn't hurt you or, you know, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I've been wondering, Ray... Marshall picks up the newspaper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says in the headline, "I slept with a murderer, says shaken Miami woman." She lives in Little Havana, her husband's out of town working when one of the escapees shows up at her door... She closes the glass door, so that they won't hear her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was it answered the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just worried maybe I'm not old enough for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  He has a cop's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?  Wait-- you have my wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I could have them back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see.  You could come on by my dad's place, drop 'em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll just leave 'em with the S.W.A.T. guy answers the door. Foley stops flipping through the magazine, stares at what been looking for: an ad for Defiance perfume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a guy here on the task force right now.  Maybe I should put him on the phone, let you two work it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're having too much fun. She doesn't know what to say to that.  Foley smells the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She fixes him pork chops and rice, the next thing you know they're making love on the sofa.  She says he was very gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to her.  The guy told her he missed his little girl and she felt sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you score now?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PATIO
dialogues.text: Karen looks inside at her father talking with Ray Nicolet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's retired.  He was a Private Investigator.  Forty years.  I used to work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can just picture that, a cute girl like you following slip-and-fall and whiplash cheaters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I've been wondering, what ever happened to your Uncle Cully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You think he might tell you where I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you wanna tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.  He did twenty-seven years before he came out and died not too long after in Charity Hospital, I think trying to make up for all the good times he'd missed. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last score, that the idea?  Move to some island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm partial to mountains myself.  But if you like islands, we'll make it an island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean we'll make it an island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought maybe you and me could-- Buddy opens the door, sticks his head out, startles Foley

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Buddy? Foley's caught off guard, hangs up the phone.  He looks a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better come see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen stands on the balcony another moment, then hangs opens the sliding door and walks back into the living roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman also said he stole her husband's gun, a twenty-two pistol, and some of his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the woman's married.  She goes to bed with this prison escapee because he misses his little girl and then tells the world about it.  But you don't reveal her name, you protect her.  It sounds like you're saying it's okay as long as her husband doesn't find out about it.  Like the guy who cheats on his wife, saying what she doesn't know won't hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. He looks over at her now.  Gives her an innocent look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley and Buddy watch a news report on the earlier eve the hobo camp.  We catch a glimpse of RAY NICOLET, GUN IN WAISTBAND, STICKING HIS CHEST OUT FOR THE CAMERA. Foley shakes his head as they show a shot of Lulu's body with a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chino's gonna wanna talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running for his life, he doesn't give a shit about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta know by now that I gave him up back at Glades.  He does, he's gonna try to find me.  Maybe go see Adele, see what she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where she lives? Foley doesn't answer.  Buddy mutes the set.  Turns to Fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were talking one time, drinking rum.  I may've mentioned Adele, how she worked for a magician.  Chino got interested.  He's like, Yeah?  How does he saw the woman in half?  He wanted to meet her.  Or get a look at her if she ever came to visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So call her up.  Tell her don't talk to any Cubans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her phone's probably tapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know they're gonna have some people watching the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands there with her car keys and purse as Marshal the trim on the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, pay attention to how she talks about Foley, her tone.  Do it right, she'll tell you things she wouldn't tell Burdon.  Tell her you think he's a nice guy.  No, first tell her about being in the trunk with him, in the dark for half an hour, and see how she takes it.  If she's in on it, what does she get for all the aggravation; cops breathing on her?  I bet nothing.  So she still likes him enough to stick her neck out.  You think that's possible?  What kind of guy is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty laid back, confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He remind you of that guy, Tillman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know he's dirty and you still wanna see him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to bust his ass, put him in shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  But you're also curious about the man.  Twice last night you asked your married boyfriend Nicolet about him.  You were concerned, but you didn't want to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My married boyfriend - setting him up with that news story so you could talk about infidelity.  I couldn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like the wild ones, don't you? Tillman, Nicolet and now Foley.  You know, I've always said there's a thin line between the cowboy cops and the armed robbers, all those guys that love to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley kidnapped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you talked all the way from GCI to the turnpike.  It sounds more like a first date than a kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look.  He goes back to his painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go talk to the ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Adele comes in, drops a stack of her cards on the glas dining table and turns on the window air-conditioner when PHONE RINGS.  She grabs it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Adele speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele's neighbourhood.  Near the beach.  Chino on the pho wears a painter's cap and a white jumpsuit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is this Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- sorry.  Wrong number. He hangs up, glances about, then checks the little .22 st one of his pockets.  As he then starts off down the stree can see the name "COLOR MY WORLD HOUSEPAINTING" on the ba the jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy drives.  Foley -- in a bright orange and ochre beac is beside him.  Buddy looks at him, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You at least bring the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts straw bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here with my suntan lotion and beach towel. (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her place. As they drive past, Buddy indicates a MAN on the steps ou obviously FBI...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  You see the guy sitting on the porch?  The old ladies and one guy? You know they'll have a couple more in a car somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching something else)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... Buddy follows Foley's gaze to...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: As a car door opens and Karen Sisco gets out, rifles her for change.  She drops a quarter, Foley now watching as s bends down to grab it, her skirt hiking way up her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my. Foley watches, her hair in her face as she tries to reach the car and grab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you saw her.  That's all you get. They watch as she walks to the Normandie and shows the YO AGENT her ID...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Adele's in good hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure looks that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele has the chain on the door, talks to Karen through t narrow opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were both in the trunk? Together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Glades to the turnpike.  Then I left with Glenn. Karen watches Adele's face in the opening, freshly made u heavy on the eye shadow and lip gloss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI didn't tell you I was with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't tell me anything, they asked questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what I'm talking about, don't you?  About Glenn, don't you, and the second car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a Glenn. She thinks a moment.  The door closes and opens again, al way.  Adele stands there in a robe, hanging partly open, but no bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting ready to go out.  You can come in if you want, sit down for a minute.  Would you like a Diet Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks. She comes in, checks out the place.  She turns a chair fr glasstop table and sits down as Adele comes out of the kitchenette with a Diet Coke and packet of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are cute shoes.  The kind of jobs I get, I have to wear these killer spikes, they ruin your feet. She walks away, comes back with an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were in the trunk with Jack... Karen waits, watches her light her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't hurt you or anything, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, did he try to jump me?  No, but he was kind of talkative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets that way when he's nervous sometimes. Adele sits down at the other end of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't visit him in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't want me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  He was different after he was sentenced, looking at thirty years.  Said it depressed him every time the younger cons called him an old timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you spoke to him on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd call every once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called the day he escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?  I don't remember.  Did he say about me?  In the trunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, lies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he wished the two of you could start over, live a normal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.  Problem is, Jack's idea of a normal life is robbing banks.  It's all he's ever done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that when you married him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was a card player.  I could live with that.  I never knew he robbed banks till he got busted with that car that caught fire -- if you can imagine something like that happening, comes out of the bank and the car's on fire. I did go see him in jail to tell him I was filing for divorce.  He said, "Okay."  Jack's so easy going. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was fun, but never what you'd call a real husband. Adele looks out the window.  Karen waits, looks to an end where she sees a photograph of Jack and Adele on a boat s ten years back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say one thing for Jack, he was never ugly or mean, or drank too much. He was very considerate, lights on or off, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. (looking at the picture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm. She realizes Adele is looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele, sooner or later, he's gonna get caught.  I'd like to get him before he does something else, makes it worse on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy'll take care of him.  Keep him out've trouble.  He's Jack's conscience. Always has been. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tell you how they met? Karen shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack came out of a bank he just robbed in Pasadena, couldn't get his stolen car to start.  Battery was dead.  He looks over, sees Buddy sitting in a burgundy Bonneville, goes up, offers him a thousand dollars for a jump. Turns out, Buddy was casing the same bank and saw the whole thing.  Buddy says, I'll take the thousand, but we're leaving in my car, not that piece of shit you come in. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They musta robbed fifty banks together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till they got busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't Jack's fault.  No, that was on account of Buddy, for some reason, decided to call his sister and confess to a job before they'd done it instead of after.  She called the FBI and they both went down, ended up at Lompoc. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Buddy felt kinda bad about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea where I could find Buddy?  Or Glenn? Adele looks at Karen, then jumps at the sound of three qu raps on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adele?  You in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak with you, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talk to the guy you work for, Emil. He tole me your number and where you live.  See, I'm looking for an assistant and would like to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did work for Emil, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was Emil's box-jumper for almost four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were his what, his box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His assistant. Karen looks at the door. Something's wrong... through th bricks that line one side of the door, we see blurred mov on the other side, someone doing something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you perform in the Miami area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, around here.  I was a mayishan in Cuba before I come here.  Manuel the Mayishan was my name. And now Karen and Adele look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you open the door? Karen shakes her head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. (lowers his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good friend of Jack Foley. Boom.  Karen gets to her feet, brings her bag to the edge the table, sees Adele staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jose Chirino. Karen brings her Beretta out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe you hear Jack Foley call me Chino.  I'm the same person. Karen moves along the table to Adele...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to wait in the hall, you have to get dressed.  Say it loud. As Adele speaks, Karen racks the slide on her 9mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait in the hall!  I have to get dressed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where is Jack Foley, I don't bother you no more. Karen motions for Adele to keep talking as she takes a po beside the door, where we now see Chino's silhouette in o the three glass panels in the centre of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm the one help Jack escape from prison.  He tole me, I can't find him to see you.  So why don't you open this fucking door.  Okay?  So we can speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Karen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away, or I'll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you want to do that, to a frien'? Adele says nothing.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you don't want to help me, I'm leaving. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going now.  I see you maybe some time, okay?  Bye bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in the bedroom and -- Suddenly, Chino's fist -- wrapped in his shirt -- explode through one of the glass panels.  Adele and Karen both ju Chino pushes his arm through, reaches for the door knob.. ...but Karen grabs the knob first and, using all of her w as leverage, pivots and flings the door open with Chino's still sticking through the glass... ...the force of which slingshots the man into the room wh bangs against a wall and falls to the floor.  Dazed, Chin reaches for his .22 as he now tries to get to his feet. Karen brings up her Beretta in two hands, cocks it and pu front sight on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  You not Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a federal marshal and you're under arrest.  Put the gun on the table.  I mean, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Then this must be Adele... He now aims the gun point-blank at Adele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down or I'll shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't shoot me, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could walk out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you move, if you look at her again, you're dead. Chino doesn't move.  Keeps his gun on Adele.  Karen start walking towards him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can live or die, it's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that right?  You going to shoot me?  Nice girl like you? (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't, huh? And with that, she kicks him in the knee.  Chino buckles and she hits him on the side of the head with her gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees. He does as he's told.  Karen raises his jacket, feels aro his waist from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie face down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! She kicks him over onto his stomach and stays there.  She her foot to his back as she reaches for the phone, dials. sees Adele staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adele)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Karen looks at Adele a moment, then says into the phone..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Burdon, please.  Karen Sisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Adele?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do the sawing of the box in half trick with you inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, how do you do that? Adele looks at Karen, who shoves Chino's head to the floo her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen.  Where are you?  I been trying to get a hold of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel.  Listen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?  I been trying to reach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at Adele Delisi's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-- we already talked to her.  That's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Chino)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.  I was just leaving. Why were you trying to reach me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a Buddy Bragg at Lompoc around the same time Foley was there.  We got an address for him at the Adams Hotel in Hallandale.  I want you to go there, see if you can get the manager to i.d. him as the other guy.  If he does, you call me right away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't you do anything.  You just have a seat, wait for me to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.  What is it you wanted to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just wondering, if I were to bring in Chirino, would you put me on the task force?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Is that what you're calling me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no, Daniel.  If I get him, will you let me go after Foley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, Karen.  You bring in Chirino, you can be on the task force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I wanted to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Now forget about the ex-wife and get over to the Adams Hotel. Karen hangs up, looks at Adele.  Adele nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley and Buddy quickly pack up their stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing we do, we get to Detroit, we find Glenn, then we find a window to throw him out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been thinkin', if I was Glenn, I was up there to take down the Ripper, where would I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first off, if you were Glenn, you wouldn't be thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Snoopy Miller, his old pal from Lompoc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snoopy.  Christ, I thought he'd be brain dead by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't fighting no more.  Glenn told me the Snoop's been managing some guys up there now, works out at the Kronk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient residents stop what they're doing as Burdon e with eight guys in jackets and wool shirts hanging out, r shoes, half of them carrying what look like athletic bags Karen meets them as they all walk to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in 7D. She hands it to him as they wait for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want two men outside, front and back. Conway and Jessup go on up to seven, cover both ends of the hall. Burdon, Karen and the remaining four SWAT team agents.  B looks at them one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're primary, you're secondary, you're point man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna use a ram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager's door is metal. They all look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean?  They might all be. And a ram on a metal door makes an awful lot of noise for what good it does. Burdon looks at her, not all that happy she spoke up.  Th man raises the shotgun, a three-inch strip of metal taped the muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a shock-lock round in my shotgun oughta do the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Whatever. He sees the elevator still hasn't come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.  Let's take the stairs. Karen... Burdon pauses, looks at Karen, hands her a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the radio, stay down here in the lobby, watch the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Daniel, I wanna go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go wait out in the car, you want to. She doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you see Foley and this guy Bragg come in behind us, whatta you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call and tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you let them come up.  You don't try to make the bust yourself.  You understand? Before she can answer, an old woman steps in, asks Burdon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you delivering the oxygen? Burdon looks at her, then nods for his men to start up th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SEVENTH FLOOR
dialogues.text: Everyone's in position as Burdon eases the key into the l turns it.  The door won't budge, a dead bolt holds it shu The guy with the shotgun puts the strip of metal against seam, where the lock enters the frame, the muzzle of the exactly three inches now from the dead bolt, and looks ov shoulder at Burdon. With the sound of the blast, we then...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: As Foley and Buddy ride down with an old lady.  The doors The woman doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your floor, mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an old gent in a golf cap smiles at Karen sitting ther the couch in front of the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like to play some gin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. He creeps off towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Burdon and his men fan out through the place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear Burdon's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
