dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A minute or two, you're gonna wish you were. Ripley looks at him.  Foley pats the back of a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come on over here, sit down, Richard, have a look at your fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen slowly negotiates her way through the snowstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music ON LOUD (Herb Alpert -- Tijuana Taxi).  Buddy s in the doorway, watches Maurice, out of his coveralls, as takes suits and sport coats from the walk-in closet to lo them over.  He tries on a coat, turns to the maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look, mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a fag. Maurice smiles at her, goes back into the closet.  Kennet at the maid, nodding slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she like to tussle with me. Get boned a way she gonna remember. She looks to the doorway, where Buddy now starts to take into the room, when Maurice comes out of the closet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! He sticks his head out of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the safe. Buddy backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen drives slowly past the house.  White Boy Bob eme with an armload of steaks and sets them on the front step

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White Boy!  Get your ass up here! White Boy Bob hurries back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley sits on the couch across from Foley.  He keeps loo up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me, Jack?  Name it.  You want money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna write me a check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go to my bank.  I'll make a withdrawal. Foley just looks at him.  Buddy sticks his head in the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Buddy, don't you, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hi.  Nice house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White Boy Bob comes in as Kenneth and Maurice are getting to blast the safe with the shotgun and pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna open up this fucker... Maurice and his boys open fire on the safe.  The maid cov as bullets begin ricocheting all over the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sees the muzzle flashes in the upstairs window and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy and Ripley look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God... they're shooting Midge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushes him down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddown, Dick.  They're trying to open the safe, not your maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice, Kenneth and White Boy Bob get ready to fire a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'ight, this time we gotta get the motherfuckin' trajectory right... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, on three:  One... Two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combination is three-ten-forty-four. They all turn to look at her, guns still pointing at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen cautiously makes her way towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice finally gets the safe open.  They all anxiousl inside.  Maurice narrows his eyes, reaches in, pulls out three toupees.  He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the fuck is this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they dead? He looks at White Boy Bob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find Foley.  NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley leans forward in the chair now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're still angry with me, Jack, after all this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not angry, Richard. (staring at the tank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I'm completely relaxed.  Thing is, I can't tell if it's the fish that're cooling me out or all those uncut diamonds on the bottom of the tank there. Ripley sags, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn-- And now Buddy takes a closer look and now we, too, see th strewn about the bottom of the aquarium are dozens of unc diamonds of various sizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbfuck Glenn was right, there's about five million worth in there, wouldn't you say, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five point two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like plain old rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sure do. He gets up, looks at Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get a bag. Foley turns to Richard as Buddy comes back into the room plastic bag, starts reaching into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I were you, I'd get up and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving Midge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an asshole, Richard.  They're gonna kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's my fate, so be it.  I'm not leaving. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her, Jack. Foley looks at Buddy.  Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Foley just looks at Ripley, who doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone down here? Buddy and Foley slip out the other door, down the hall, j Maurice walks in, some of Ripley's clothes over his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn't the Ripper hisself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those my suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been hiding, Dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A now-freezing Karen hugs a retaining wall, watches as Fo and Buddy emerge from the house.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE VAN
dialogues.text: As Buddy leans under the dash.  Foley looks up at the hou where we see shadows moving about in the upstairs window, the faint pumping of the music.  We hear the VAN START.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Buddy straightens up, looks at Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna rape the maid, aren't they.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the looks of those boys, the Ripper too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they'll kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least. Foley looks at the diamonds in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you gotta do is get in. Again Foley looks at the diamonds, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you. Foley finally hands him the bag with the diamonds in it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you dump the van, meet me at the airport. I'll take one of Ripley's cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Buddy, the shit that's about to go down, you'll be on the phone with your sister for a month.  Let me do this part alone. Buddy just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying this isn't your problem. Far as I'm concerned, we're square. Foley turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Buddy hands him his gun.  Foley takes it, stuffs it in th of his pants, and then turns back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she watches Foley go back inside.  A moment later, the pulls out of the driveway.  Karen makes a decision, start the side of the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley enters and we hear the maid scream.  Foley starts u the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice and White Boy Bob both have their guns to Ripley'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hears the scream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about her.  Tell me where the money's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley's got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Foley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley comes up the stairs, heads for Ripley's bedroom.  T door is closed now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midge? He steps to one side, is about to reach for the knob when suddenly the DOOR IS BLASTED OFF ITS HINGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen comes through the door, hears the gunshot, stops co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley steps into the doorway and we see Kenneth and th bare, both sitting up in bed, Kenneth racking the shotgun maid turning away from him, gathering the covers that han her side of the bed... ...and coming around to throw them like a net at Kenneth shotgun goes off and the covers catch fire as Foley pumps two three shots into Kenneth somewhere under there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ripley tries to get away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midge! Maurice grabs him by the collar, spins him around and whi across the face with his gun.  He and White Boy Bob then hit Ripley on the head until he goes down and stays down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to WBB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take the front stairs, I'll take the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the maid jumps up and drags the burning covers from th and sees Kenneth now, the bullet holes in his chest, star blankly back at him.  She then looks at Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait here.  There's two more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley starts out of the room and immediately hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, asshole! Foley sees White Boy Bob at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun. Nowhere to go, Foley has to comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now stay right there.  Don't move. White Boy Bob starts to jog up the stairs two at a time, the while keeping his eyes fixed on Foley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice!  I got Foley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice starts up the backstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice!  Up here! ...and a moment later, Karen comes out of the kitchen int downstairs hallway -- just missing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As White Boy Bob gets maybe half way up when he catches a on one of the risers and pitches forward.  Stupidly, he t to break his fall with the elbow of his gun hand and ends jamming his chin down onto the muzzle of his gun which, unfortunately for him, goes off, firing a bullet through head and killing him instantly. To say the least, Foley is stunned by this freak accident stands there looking at the dead bulk on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learn from doing. Foley bends down to pick up his gun and we see MAURICE CO UP THE BACK STAIRCASE, his gun raised, and now firing awa Foley is forced to jump back behind a pillar as Maurice k firing at him, shots ricocheting off the pillar, the rail the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen hugs the wall at the sound of gunshots, sees Rip lying on the floor of the study...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we hear CLICK as the breech opens on Maurice's now emp And now Foley steps out from behind the pillar and calmly down, picks up his gun, Maurice still walking forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, you don't use a gun, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still coming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of setup, you don't have any idea what the fuck you're doing -- do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  So why take a chance-- Foley pulls the trigger.  CLICK.  Maurice hesitates, surp that Foley would pull the trigger, then the two of them a same time rush each other, begin a messy <i>mano a mano</ their spent guns as bludgeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen carefully comes into the room, Ripley lets out a GROAN.  She's bending down to check him when HER PHONE RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley and Maurice grapple on the floor near the head o stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen answers her phone, checks Ripley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a few minutes away.  Just sit tight, stay outta the house till we get there, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-kay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley finally shoves Maurice down the stairs.  Maurice down a few steps, right over White Boy Bob, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley gets up, runs back to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley enters, goes straight to Kenneth's body, begins searching for the shotgun (lifting the covers, turning ov the body, etc) with no success...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice attempts to prise the gun out from under the d of White Boy Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley, exasperated, stands back up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what you want? Foley looks to where Midge stands -- now back in her bath but more importantly, clutching the shotgun.  Foley cross takes it from her, begins to stride out of the room, when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty. Foley just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice finally rolls White Boy Bob over, grabs the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley sticks his hand in Kenneth's coveralls, comes ou a shell, loads the gun, snaps it shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice cocks the pistol, takes a step up the stairs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice-- Maurice spins around, points his gun down at Karen, now s in the foyer, her own gun pointing up at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Raymond Cruz and several green-and-whites arrive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack, about to exit, stops cold as he HEARS TWO GUNSHO then a BODY FALL. He stands still.  Not sure who was just shot.  After a lo we then hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? He sees Midge looking at him, closes his eyes, sags again wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Foley steps into the hallway, his ski mask now pulled over his face.  He holds Kenneth's shotgun in one hand an pistol in another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack -- don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend I'm somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd shoot you? Foley brings up the pistol and the shotgun.  AND NOW WE H THE SIRENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't, one of those guys will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you now, a desperado?  Put the guns down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm not going back. He raises the guns hip-high and we hear sounds behind Kar but she's quick to raise her hand, though she doesn't tur look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.  Please. They stand there staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more time outs. He raises the guns.  She sadly shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win, Jack. She fires and he falls to the staircase, dropping the gun grabbing hold of his right thigh.  And now Cruz and sever other cops enter... Karen motions them to stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, I told you not to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I know him --okay? She goes up the staircase to where Foley is lying and gen lifts the ski mask and looks at his sad eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack, but I can't shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just did, for Christ sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. She glances about, makes sure no one can hear, then leans to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish things were different.  I'm sorry, Jack. Foley looks like he's in pain.  He watches as she walks b down the stairs.  As a couple of uniform cops rush past h pick up Foley, a shaky Ripley staggers into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard! She comes running down the stairs into his arms.  They em He looks at Foley over her shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jack... (but then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do with my diamonds? Foley just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buddy pulls the van into an alley.  He jumps out, jogs to the street and hails a cab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy suddenly gets in, bangs on the bulletproof glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport. The cab pulls away.  Buddy glances up front, then pulls t Ziploc bag from his coat and holds it up.  There's a bit water in along with the diamonds.  A tiny fish swims in t water.  Something about this makes Buddy smile as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is out.  The sky is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know yet if they want to bring him up on the homicides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen on the phone.  Her suitcase on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt if they will.  The Bureau's put a detainer on him, so when they're through with him here he'll go back to Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna go get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking... you could have a nice time with him on the plane -- like picking up where your interlude, or whatever you call it, left off. And then throw him in the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew what he was doing.  Nobody forced him to rob banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little girl, the tough babe. Karen hangs up, stares thoughtfully out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Foley stands staring out of his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foley. As Foley turns around and faces a FEDERAL MARSHAL in the we see that Foley's hands and feet are shackled.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PRISON STATION GARAGE
dialogues.text: The Marshal leads Foley from the building to where a blac government van waits.  The Marshal helps Foley inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice trip. (looks OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the other one.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. VAN
dialogues.text: As Foley sits down, stares at the floor.  He looks depres We hear the front door open, then close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? He looks to where Karen looks at him through a steel grat separates the front from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a present, something for the road. She pushes A ZIPPO THROUGH the grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to take it away, though, soon as the ride's over. Before Foley can say anything, the back door is opened on more and the Marshal helps ANOTHER PRISONER -- a black ma a shaved head -- into the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Foley meet Hejira Henry. An annoyed Foley stares at the guy as the marshal shuts t door then gets in up front with Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hejira? What kinda name is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islamic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it mean, "No Hair"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hejira was the flight of Mohammed from Mecca in 622.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brothers in Leavenworth gave me the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were at Leavenworth, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning time came, I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You busted out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer to call it an exodus from an undesirable place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how long was it before they caught up with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That was the ninth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ninth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten, you count the prison hospital in Ohio I walked away from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be some kinda walker, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hejira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so now you're off to Glades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, yeah.  I was supposed to leave last night with the lady marshal, but for some reason she wanted to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Karen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheaper I guess, take us both down in one van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, could be.  Or maybe she thought we'd have a lot to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long way down to Florida. Foley glances at her, then turns back to Heiira Henry and considers the guy; a smile on Foley's face, his spirits a higher than when he first sat down, as we then... CUT TO BLACK.
